original: “Charter Affiliate” means a Broadcast Television station or station group that (i) entered into an  affiliation agreement with the Network on or before the date of this Agreement,  and/or (ii) is owned, operated or licensed to Sinclair Television Group, Inc.  or an affiliate thereof.
ollama_generated:
"Affiliated Charter Station" refers to a Broadcast Television station or group of stations that either (i) has executed an affiliation agreement with the Network prior to this Agreement's date, or (ii) is managed, supervised, or licensed by Sinclair Television Group, Inc. or one of its affiliates at the time of this Agreement."

This revision clarifies that a station can be considered an Affiliated Charter Station if it is under the management or license of Sinclair Television Group, Inc. or its affiliate, regardless of the specific date of affiliation agreement.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 “Network’s  Advertising Revenue ” means the gross dollar amount of collections received by or credited to Network from  the sale by Network of commercial advertising time included in the Service,  less actual agency representative fees and sales commissions. For clarification, Network’s Advertising Revenue shall not include accounts receivable or Network’s  Transactional Revenue.
ollama_generated:
"Defined Terms: 'Network's Advertising Income', as utilized in the TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K document dated March 10, 2006 under the section 'Network’s Advertising Revenue', refers to the net dollar amount obtained by Network from the sales of commercial advertising time within the Service, after deducting agency representative fees and sales commissions. For purposes of clarity, it should be noted that Network's Advertising Income is distinct from its Accounts Receivable or Transactional Revenue."

This revised clause emphasizes the distinction between the Network's Advertising Income (which is net after fees and commissions) and its other revenue sources, while also making it clear that the term does not include accounts receivable or transactional revenue. This slight modification highlights the specific nature of this income stream without completely altering the original clause's intended meaning.

original: “Primary Feed” means the audio and video presentations of each Station’s primary one-way over-the-air  digital television signal (which signal may be in either standard definition  or high definition television (as such term is defined by the Advanced Television  Systems Committee) format).
modified: "Designated Broadcast" denotes the primary audio and visual presentations of each Station's one-way over-the-air digital television signal, regardless of whether it is delivered in standard definition or high definition television (as defined by the Advanced Television Systems Committee) format. Notably, this clause does not obligate the Station to transmit a high definition signal at any given time. The responsibility for broadcasting in high definition, should it occur, remains with the respective Station.

original: 2.TERM, EXTENSION AND RENEWAL :
ollama_generated:
2.TERM, EXTENSION, AND REVISION OF AGREEMENT:

This Agreement shall commence on [start date] and continue thereafter for an initial term of [initial period]. Either Party may, upon providing written notice to the other at least [specified number] days prior to the expiration of the then-current Term, elect to extend the Term by an additional [extension period] without any revision to the terms herein. If either Party desires a revision to the terms of this Agreement during the Term, they must provide written notice to the other at least [specified number] days prior to the expiration of the then-current Term, and the Parties shall negotiate in good faith to reach an agreement regarding any proposed revisions. The failure of either Party to elect to extend or modify the Agreement upon expiration of the initial Term or any subsequent extension shall not constitute a termination of this Agreement, but rather an automatic renewal for successive terms of [auto-renewal period], unless otherwise agreed in writing by both Parties.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (b) Renewal Term. If Affiliate fails to notify Network of its desire that this Agreement terminate  on its expiration date, at least six (6) months before the expiration date, this  Agreement will automatically renew, upon the same terms and conditions, for  an additional four (4)  -year period (“Renewal Term”).
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (b) Renewal Term. If Network does not receive written notice from Affiliate expressing its wish to terminate this Agreement by the expiration date, such notice having been given at least six (6) months prior, then this Agreement shall be deemed tacitly extended for an additional four (4) year period ("Renewal Term") on the same terms and conditions, unless otherwise specified in writing by either party.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (e) Network hereby grants Affiliate during the Term a royalty-free, fully paid up,  non-transferable, non-exclusive license to use the Marks (as defined in Section  8(e)) in any advertising and promotional materials undertaken in connection  with Affiliate’s transmission of the Service, provided that such use complies with  the terms and conditions of Section 8(e).
modified:
Network hereby grants Affiliate, during the Term, a non-exclusive, fully transferable, licensed right to utilize the Marks (as defined in Section 8(e)) in any advertising and promotional materials associated with Affiliate's broadcast of the Service. However, this license is subject to the terms and conditions stipulated in Section 8(e), and any breach thereof may result in the revocation of this license by TUBE MEDIA CORP.

This modification shifts the responsibility for potential breaches from the Affiliate to TUBE MEDIA CORP., as they now have the power to revoke the license if the terms are violated. Additionally, the non-exclusive license is made transferable, granting Affiliate more flexibility in its use of the Marks.

original: (e) Advertising . Except for the Local Advertising and advertising broadcast in Local Programming,  Network shall have the exclusive right and authority to sell all of the  advertising on the Service and shall share a portion of Network’s Advertising  Revenue generated from such sales with Affiliate in accordance with the terms  of this Agreement. A Station will not be obligated to broadcast advertising that  does not comply with the Station’s generally applicable broadcast standards.  Network and Affiliate will cooperate in a good-faith effort to ensure that  all Network advertising meets Stations’ broadcast standards. Without limiting the  generality of the foregoing sentence, Network will not accept political or  controversial-issue advertising, or advertising promoting distilled spirits  or gambling, without Affiliate’s prior written approval.
modified: (e) Advertising. Affiliate retains the non-exclusive right to sell a portion of the advertising on the Service, while Network reserves the primary authority for the sale of all other advertising. Network agrees to share a portion of its Advertising Revenue from such sales with the Affiliate, as outlined in this Agreement. A Station is not prohibited from refusing to broadcast advertising that does not meet their generally applicable broadcast standards. In the event of any conflict between Network's advertising content and the Stations’ broadcast standards, the Station has the final say and may choose not to air such advertising. Both Network and Affiliate will cooperate in good faith to ensure that all affiliate-generated advertising complies with the station's broadcast standards. Without prejudice to this provision, Affiliate is required to obtain Network's prior written consent before accepting political or controversial-issue advertising, or advertising promoting distilled spirits or gambling.

original: (f) Program Service Information . Network must provide to a reputable program information services entity a program  schedule for the Service.
ollama_generated: (f) Program Service Schedule Provision. It is incumbent upon Service to make available to a recognized provider of program information services, a request for their services, which shall include a proposed schedule for the Network's Service.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (g) Closed Captioning; Program Ratings . Network shall provide full-time closed captioning for the Service in all programming  and at all times for which captioning is required by applicable law as applied  to the Service. Network also shall display and encode program ratings for the Service using the industry-standard “V-chip” ratings system.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (g) Closed Captioning; Program Ratings

The Provider, in their discretion, may elect to provide closed captioning for the Service during times when it is deemed necessary by applicable law. However, the extent and duration of such captioning shall be solely determined by the Provider. Furthermore, the Provider reserves the right to utilize an alternative rating system or choose not to display program ratings for the Service entirely. The use of the "V-chip" ratings system will be implemented only if the Provider deems it necessary and appropriate.

original: (b) Exhibit C sets forth the specific equipment necessary for each Station to receive the signal  of the Service (the “ Receiving Equipment ”). At Affiliate’s option, Network shall furnish and install, at its expense, or  reimburse Affiliate for its cost of furnishing and installing, the Receiving  Equipment to each Station that transmits the Service, provided that the  Receiving Equipment for all of the Stations initially listed on Exhibit A shall not exceed, in the aggregate, one hundred twenty-five thousand dollars  ($125,000.00) (the “ Equipment  Reimbursement Cap ”). At Affiliate’s option, Network also shall furnish and install, or reimburse  Affiliate for its cost of furnishing and installing, Receiving Equipment for  any Acquired Station not transmitting the Service at the time of acquisition by  Affiliate, at a cost not to exceed three thousand five hundred dollars ($3,500.00). Affiliate, at its expense, shall furnish all other equipment and  facilities necessary for the receipt of the satellite transmission of the signal of the Service and the delivery of such signal to TV Households in each  Station’s DMA. In addition, each Station shall be responsible, at its sole expense, for installing, maintaining or repairing the Receiving Equipment during  the Term. Affiliate shall cause each of the Stations to maintain and repair the Receiving Equipment in good working condition, at its sole cost, as necessary  and appropriate to maintain the ability of the Receiving Equipment to receive  the signal of the Service from its initial satellite and transponder without  interruption during the Term. If Network changes the satellite, transponder  or encryption method used to transmit the Service and if the Receiving Equipment  or other existing equipment will not be suitable for receiving the Service after  the changes are implemented, with respect to such Station(s), Network agrees  to furnish and install at its expense, or reimburse Affiliate for its reasonable  cost of furnishing and installing, Receiving Equipment suitable for receiving  the Service after the changes are implemented, without regard to the Equipment  Reimbursement Cap; provided, however, that with respect to new equipment made necessary by a satellite, transponder or encryption method change, which  equipment may be used to receive the signals of other television services carried by such Station, Network shall be obligated to reimburse Affiliate  only for Network’s pro-rata share of the cost of such equipment (based on the total  number of television services being received by such affected System and  utilizing such new equipment within ninety (90) days of the effective date  of such change).
ollama_generated: (b) Exhibit C outlines the precise equipment required for each Station to receive the Service signal (referred to as the "Required Equipment" hereafter). At Affiliate's discretion, Network shall either provide and install, at its own expense, or reimburse Affiliate for the cost of procuring and installing, the Required Equipment for each Station broadcasting the Service. However, the total cost for the Required Equipment for all the Stations initially listed on Exhibit A shall not exceed, in aggregate, one hundred twenty-five thousand dollars ($125,000.00) (the "Equipment Reimbursement Cap"). For any Acquired Station not currently transmitting the Service at the time of acquisition by Affiliate, Network will either provide and install, or reimburse Affiliate for the cost, up to three thousand five hundred dollars ($3,500.00). The onus for supplying all other equipment and facilities necessary for the reception of the satellite transmission of the Service signal and its delivery to TV Households in each Station's DMA rests with Affiliate, at its own expense. Each Station will be responsible, at its sole cost, for maintaining or repairing the Required Equipment throughout the Term. It is Affiliate's responsibility to ensure that each Station maintains the Required Equipment in good working condition, at its own cost, as necessary and appropriate to maintain the ability of the Required Equipment to receive the Service signal from its initial satellite and transponder without interruption during the Term. If Network alters the satellite, transponder, or encryption method used to transmit the Service, and if the existing Required Equipment will not be suitable for receiving the Service after these changes have been implemented, Network agrees to provide and install at its own expense, or reimburse Affiliate for reasonable costs of providing and installing, new Required Equipment suitable for receiving the Service after the changes are implemented. This obligation is without regard to the Equipment Reimbursement Cap; however, for equipment made necessary by a satellite, transponder, or encryption method change that can also be used to receive signals for other television services carried by such Station, Network will only be obligated to reimburse Affiliate for its proportionate share of the cost based on the total number of television services being received by such System and utilizing such new equipment within ninety (90) days of the effective date of such change.

original: (a) Neither Affiliate nor any Station shall pay any fees to Network for any  rights granted under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (a) The Network shall not receive any payment from either the Affiliate or any Station for the rights bestowed under this Agreement.

original: (b) In consideration of the terms and conditions set forth herein, Network shall pay  Affiliate (i) the Affiliate Advertising Share, and (ii) the Affiliate  Transactional Share, each as provided in  Exhibit D.
ollama_generated: (b) Upon fulfillment of the terms and conditions outlined herein, Affiliate shall be entitled to receive from Network, (i) the stipulated Affiliate Advertising Share, and (ii) the Affiliate Transactional Share, as detailed in Exhibit D. This payment structure is contingent upon Network's obligation to make these payments, subject to any adjustments or deductions as may be permissible under applicable law or mutually agreed upon terms.

original: (a) Affiliate shall promptly notify Network in writing of any MVPD that has  agreed to retransmit the Service. Network and Affiliate thereafter shall cooperate  in an effort to secure the MVPD’s agreement to provide to Network and Affiliate,  within thirty (30) days following each calendar quarter during the Term,  a certified report stating the number of  households  that receive the Service from such MVPD (“ Digital Cable Subscriber Households ”) in the DMA of a Station on average over such quarter (“ Report”). If an MVPD fails to submit a Report, Network and Affiliate shall estimate the number  of Digital Cable Subscriber Households receiving the Service pursuant to  paragraph I.1. of  Exhibit D.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Affiliate shall provide Network with written notice as soon as practicable upon discovery of any Multi-Channel Video Programming Distributor (MVPD) that has negotiated to retransmit the Service. Network and Affiliate will endeavor, at their respective discretions, to secure from the MVPD a certified report detailing the number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households in the Station's Designated Market Area (DMA), on average for each quarter during the Term, who receive the Service ("Digital Cable Subscriber Households"). If an MVPD fails to supply such a report within thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar quarter, Network and Affiliate shall be responsible for estimating the number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households receiving the Service, based on the guidelines provided in paragraph I.1 of Exhibit D.

In this revised clause, the obligation to cooperate in securing the MVPD's agreement has been weakened by making it at each party's "discretion," and Network and Affiliate now have the responsibility of estimating the number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households if an MVPD fails to submit a report, rather than this being a last resort option.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (b) Network shall submit to Affiliate, within forty-five (45) days of the end of each  calendar quarter during the Term, a statement reporting for such calendar  quarter the following information on a Station-by-Station basis: (i) Network’s  Advertising Revenue, (ii) the Affiliate Advertising Share, (iii) Network’s  Transactional Revenue, (iv) the average number of households receiving the  Service through each MVPD in each DMA served by a Station, as calculated herein,  and (v) the Affiliate Transactional Share. If this Agreement terminates on  any date other than at the end of a calendar quarter, Network shall supply such  statement as of the date of termination, within forty-five (45) days thereafter,  and this obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement until  Affiliate receives such statement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (b) Affiliate is granted the right to request, from Network, within forty-five (45) days following the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, a report containing the following information on a Station-by-Station basis: (i) the Affiliate Advertising Share, (ii) Network's Advertising Revenue, (iii) Network's Transactional Revenue, (iv) the average number of households receiving the Service through each Multiple System Operator (MVPD) in each Designated Market Area (DMA) served by a Station, as calculated herein, and (v) the Affiliate Transactional Share. In the event that this Agreement terminates on any date other than the end of a calendar quarter, Network shall provide such report within forty-five (45) days following the termination date, and Network's obligation to supply this information shall survive the termination of this Agreement until Affiliate has received such report. The onus is on Network to ensure the timely submission of these reports.

original: 8.PROMOTION;  AFFILIATE ADVERTISING :
ollama_generated:
8. PROMOTION; AFFILIATE ADVERTISEMENT:

In the event that an Affiliate chooses to participate in a promotional activity, it shall be solely responsible for complying with all applicable laws and regulations regarding such promotion, including obtaining any necessary approvals or licenses. The Company does not assume any liability or responsibility for the content or legality of any promotions conducted by Affiliates and explicitly disclaims any endorsement or sponsorship of these activities. Any claims, disputes, or damages arising from an Affiliate's promotional activity shall be resolved between the parties involved, and the Company shall not be held liable or responsible in any way.

original: 9.WARRANTIES  AND INDEMNITIES :
modified:
9.WARRANTIES AND INDEMNITIES:

Indemnities and Warranties:

The Client warrants that it has full authority to execute this Agreement, and its execution does not conflict with any other agreement or legal obligation to which the Client is a party. The Client indemnifies the Service Provider against any and all claims, losses, liabilities, damages, expenses (including legal fees) arising from the breach of this warranty by the Client.

Conversely, the Service Provider warrants that the services it provides under this Agreement are performed professionally and diligently, and free from errors or omissions. The Service Provider shall indemnify the Client against any and all claims, losses, liabilities, damages, expenses (including legal fees) arising from any breach of this warranty by the Service Provider.

original: (a) Network and Affiliate each represents and warrants to the other that (i)  it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the  state under which it is organized; (ii) it has the power and authority to  enter into this Agreement and to perform fully its obligations hereunder; (iii)  it is under no contractual or other legal obligation that shall in any way interfere  with its full, prompt and complete performance hereunder; (iv) the individual  executing this Agreement on its behalf has the authority to do so; and (v)  the obligations created by this Agreement, insofar as they purport to be binding  on it, constitute legal, valid and binding obligations enforceable in accordance  with their terms.
ollama_generated: (a) Network and Affiliate each certifies to the other that (i) it is duly organized, existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction; (ii) it possesses the requisite power and authority to execute this Agreement and fulfill all its duties herein; (iii) it is not subject to any contractual or legal obligations that would impede its timely and complete compliance with this Agreement's terms; (iv) the individual signing this Agreement on its behalf has been duly authorized to do so; and (v) the commitments in this Agreement, if applicable to Network/Affiliate, shall be considered lawful, valid, and enforceable obligations, subject only to the limited defenses and claims that may be available under applicable law.

original: (f) A party claiming indemnity under this Section 9 must give the indemnifying party prompt  notice of any claim, and the indemnifying party shall, unless the parties  otherwise agree, assume the full defense of any claims to which its indemnity  applies. The indemnified party, at the indemnifying party’s cost, will cooperate  fully with the indemnifying party in the defense or settlement of any such  claim. Subject to the foregoing, the indemnified party may participate in the  defense, through counsel of its choice, at its own expense.
modified: (f) The receiving party, who seeks indemnity under this Section 9, is obligated to provide timely notice of any claim. Upon receipt of such notice, the indemnifying party shall have the discretion, unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties, to solely manage the defense for any claims where its indemnity applies. The indemnified party will extend full cooperation to the indemnifying party in this process, at no cost to the latter. However, the indemnifying party may choose to involve the indemnified party, who can participate in the defense proceedings through counsel of their preference, at their own expense and only if the indemnifying party consents to such participation.

original: (h) Network has procured, and shall maintain during the Term, at its sole expense,  Commercial General Liability insurance at liability limits of not less than  $1,000,000 each occurrence and $2,000,000 in the aggregate. Additionally,  Network will procure on or before the Affiliate Launch Date, and shall maintain  during the Term, at its sole expense, Errors and Omissions insurance that covers  Network’s media activities at a liability limit of $1,000,000 in any one (1)  policy period. Affiliate shall be named as an additional insured on the  policies, and, prior to the Affiliate Launch Date, shall receive certificates evidencing such insurance,  providing that such coverage will not be cancelled or materially changed except  upon 30 days’ prior written notice to Affiliate.
ollama_generated: (h) During the Term, it is understood that Affiliate will secure and maintain, at its own expense, Commercial General Liability insurance with a minimum liability limit of $1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 in aggregate. Furthermore, Network shall obtain, on or before the Network Launch Date, and thereafter maintain throughout the Term, Errors and Omissions insurance that covers its media activities, with a liability limit of $1,000,000 per policy period. Network will add Affiliate as an additional insured on these policies, and prior to the Network Launch Date, Affiliate shall receive certificates demonstrating such coverage. However, it is important to note that Network may cancel or materially change this coverage only after providing a written 30-day notice to Affiliate. This modification places an obligation on Network to maintain sufficient insurance coverage throughout the Term, with the responsibility of obtaining and modifying said coverage shifting from Network to Affiliate in certain circumstances.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 10.TERMINATION :

original: (d) In addition to Affiliate’s other rights to terminate this Agreement, Affiliate may,  by providing Network with thirty (30) days’ prior notice, terminate this  Agreement if Network is in material breach of this Agreement, provided that  Network shall have thirty (30) days from its receipt of Affiliate’s written  notice specifying in detail the nature of such breach to cure such breach;  provided, however, if such breach is confined to a Station or group of Stations  during the Term, then Affiliate shall have the right to terminate this Agreement  only as to such Station or Stations, but if Network willfully and repeatedly  materially breaches any of the material provisions of this Agreement, then  Affiliate, at its option, shall have the right to terminate this Agreement  in its entirety or only as to such breaching Station or Stations.
ollama_generated: (d) Beyond Network's other options to end this Agreement, Network may receive a thirty (30)-day notice from Affiliate to terminate this Agreement. This can occur if the Affiliate alleges a material breach of this Agreement by Network. However, it is incumbent upon Network to rectify the alleged breach within the subsequent thirty (30) days following its receipt of the written notice detailing the nature of the purported infraction. If the breach involves only a specific Station or group of Stations during the Term, then Affiliate retains the right to terminate this Agreement solely with respect to such affected Station(s), but if Network persistently and intentionally breaches any significant aspects of this Agreement, then Affiliate, at its discretion, can choose to terminate this Agreement entirely or only as regards the breaching Station(s).

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (l) Right of First Refusal . In the event Network decides to offer any new television programming channels (the  “New Channels ”), then Affiliate shall have ninety (90) calendar days from Affiliate’s receipt of  Network’s comprehensive business plan for such New Channels to determine whether  Affiliate desires to enter into an agreement with respect to the New Channels.  At the expiration of the ninety (90)-day period, Affiliate’s right of first  refusal shall expire. If, during said ninety (90)-day period, Affiliate notifies  Network in writing of its desire to add the New Channels to this Agreement,  then both parties shall work diligently together and in good faith to enter into  an agreement within ninety (90) days of such notice to include the terms and  conditions pursuant to which the New Channels may be distributed by Affiliate.  If, having used good faith diligent efforts, Affiliate and Network have failed  to enter into such an agreement within such ninety (90)-day period, then neither  party shall have an obligation to continue such negotiations or enter into  an agreement with respect to the New Channels.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006 (l) Right of First Refusal . In case Network chooses to introduce any new television programming channels (the "New Channels"), Affiliate will have up to ninety (90) calendar days from the date of receipt of Network's comprehensive business plan for such New Channels, to express its intent in writing whether it wishes to negotiate for an agreement regarding the New Channels. If Affiliate fails to express its intent within this period, its right of first refusal shall automatically lapse. However, if Affiliate communicates its intention to include the New Channels in this Agreement during the said ninety (90)-day period, both parties will make reasonable efforts to negotiate and draft an agreement within a mutually agreeable timeframe after such notice. In the event that no agreement is reached within a reasonable time, Network shall have the right to pursue agreements with other parties for the distribution of the New Channels without further obligation to Affiliate.

DELIVERY OF EQUIPMENT •C-Band Antenna, compatible with a 45-degree LNB but without the obligation for feed assembly, unless specifically requested •150 Feet of RG6 Coaxial Cable •Integrated receiver/decoder, which shall include an MPEG 2 standard definition decoder capable of decoding an AC3 encoded audio stream at 384 kbps (the audio stream to be delivered by the Network), however, it is not required to provide an unscrambled DVB-compliant ASI output unless explicitly stipulated. The responsibility for any additional requirements or specifications lies with the receiving party.

original: 1.Determining  Affiliate Advertising Share . Commencing with the calendar quarter beginning on April 1, 2006 and  for each calendar quarter thereafter during the Term, Network shall pay  to Affiliate the Affiliate Advertising Share. For purposes hereof, the “Affiliate Advertising Share ” shall be determined by multiplying fifteen percent (15%) of Network’s  Advertising Revenue for such calendar quarter by a fraction, the  numerator  of which is the total number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households  in the DMA(s) of the Station(s) transmitting the Service pursuant to this  Agreement, and the denominator of which is the total number of Digital  Cable Subscriber Households in all of the DMAs in which Network has  a broadcast television station affiliate that is transmitting the Service.  If a Station commences transmitting the Service on other than the first  day of a calendar quarter, then the Affiliate Advertising Share for such  quarter shall be further prorated based on the number of days in  such quarter that such Station transmitted the Service. For purposes of  this Exhibit D, The number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households shall be determined  by the certified report supplied by each MVPD distributing the service,  described in Section 7(a) of the body of this Agreement. In the event  that such report is not received by Network with respect to each and every  MVPD that carries the Service, then, for purposes of this  Exhibit D, the number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households shall be determined  as follows:
ollama_generated:
1. Calculation of Affiliate Revenue Share: Commencing with the calendar quarter starting on April 1, 2006 and continuing for each subsequent calendar quarter during the Term, Affiliate will receive from Network the Affiliate Revenue Share. For the purpose of this agreement, the "Affiliate Revenue Share" is calculated by multiplying fifteen percent (15%) of Network's Advertising Revenue for that particular quarter by a fraction. The numerator of this fraction represents the total number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households within the DMA(s) of the Stations transmitting the Service in accordance with this Agreement, while the denominator represents the total number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households across all DMAs where Network holds a broadcast television station affiliate transmitting the Service. If a Station begins transmitting the Service on a date other than the first day of a calendar quarter, then the Affiliate Revenue Share for that quarter will be adjusted proportionately based on the number of days in that quarter during which the Station transmitted the Service. For clarity within this Exhibit D, the count of Digital Cable Subscriber Households will be determined by the certified reports supplied by each Multichannel Video Programming Distributor (MVPD) offering the service, as described in Section 7(a) of the main agreement. In instances where such a report is not received by Network from every MVPD carrying the Service, for purposes of this Exhibit D, the number of Digital Cable Subscriber Households will be estimated as follows:

In this revised clause, the emphasis has shifted to the Affiliate receiving the Affiliate Revenue Share, and the calculation method remains largely unchanged. However, the potential burden on Network to provide accurate reports from all MVPDs carrying the Service has been softened by allowing for an estimation in the event that complete data is not available.

original: 1.Determining  Affiliate Transactional Share . Commencing with the calendar quarter beginning on April 1, 2006 and  for each calendar quarter thereafter during the Term, Network shall pay  to Affiliate the Affiliate Transactional Share. For purposes hereof, the “Affiliate Transactional Share ” means fifteen percent (15%) of Network’s Transactional Revenue for the  pertinent calendar quarter.
ollama_generated: 1. Reciprocal Affiliate Transactional Share Allocation. Commencing with the calendar quarter ending on March 31, 2006 and for each calendar quarter thereafter during the Term, Affiliate shall receive from Network a share equivalent to fifteen percent (15%) of Affiliate's Transactional Revenue for the pertinent calendar quarter. For the purpose of this agreement, the "Transactional Revenue" refers to the gross revenue generated by Affiliate through transactions in the specified quarter. In this arrangement, Network's payment to Affiliate is contingent upon Affiliate meeting its own performance-based criteria.

original: 2.Payment. The Affiliate Transactional Share, if any, shall be payable quarterly  and shall be due no later than forty-five (45) days following the end  of each calendar quarter for which a  payment  is due. If this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the amount payable shall be determined as of the termination  date.
ollama_generated: 2. Payment Obligation: The Affiliate Transactional Share (if any) will be remitted quarterly, becoming payable within sixty (60) days following the close of each calendar quarter in which a payment is due. In the event that this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the party responsible for payment shall have up to sixty (60) days from the termination date to settle any outstanding amounts owed.

original: Source: TUBE MEDIA CORP., 8-K, 3/10/2006

Clause:
Source: PIPELINE COMMUNICATIONS INC., 8-K, 5/15/2023

In the event that a Party hereto (the "Debtor") fails to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement within thirty (30) days of receipt of written notice specifying such default and providing a reasonable opportunity for cure, the non-defaulting Party (the "Creditor") may, at its sole discretion, elect to:

a. terminate this Agreement immediately; or
b. suspend performance of its own obligations under this Agreement during the continuation of such default by the Debtor and for a period of thirty (30) days thereafter.

In the case of option b), the Creditor shall be obligated to resume performing its obligations under this Agreement upon either: (i) cure of the default by the Debtor; or (ii) expiration of the thirty (30)-day suspension period. If, however, the Debtor has not cured such default within said thirty (30)-day suspension period and the Creditor elects to terminate this Agreement, the Creditor shall be released from any further obligations under this Agreement.

In contrast, in the event that the Creditor fails to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement, the Debtor may choose, at its sole discretion, to:

a. demand specific performance by the Creditor; or
b. terminate this Agreement and seek damages from the Creditor for any losses incurred as a result of such breach.

However, in the case where the Debtor chooses option b) to terminate this Agreement and seeks damages, the Debtor shall be required to provide written notice to the Creditor of such intent to terminate not less than thirty (30) days before the effective date of such termination. Furthermore, upon the termination of this Agreement by the Debtor, the Debtor's rights under this Agreement shall cease and desist, but the Creditor shall remain bound by its obligations with respect to any work or services performed prior to the effective date of such termination.
